page.title: 11HOUSING IN THE FOXMOOR AREA
page.content: In this area there are houses of all kinds, detached, semi-detached, terraced, cottages, flats and a few farms. Most of the people live on either privately or publicly owned estates. An estate is a number of houses built to a plan. Also there is an open space in the middle of the estate covered with grass where children play. The paths in some estates are only wide enough to let milk floats through. There are about twelve inlets in big estates where minor roads lead out to major ones. Almost all houses built on estates have wall to wall carpets fitted when they are erected. In all houses there are electric sockets in every room. The kitchens are fitted with a gas or electricity supply.
